examples: I did not get much sleep
they must bear much of the blame

adverb.description: To a great extent; a great deal.
examples: they did not mind, much to my surprise
Nicolai's English was much the worst

phrases: I am sure she would do as much for me
I hoped as much, thanks for confirming that.
Those of us who have to travel on the Northern line have suspected as much for years.
I figured as much: I had a feeling this was the case.
his earnestness can be a bit much
origin: Middle English: shortened from muchel, from Old English micel (see mickle).
